text: If I had to be one of those people to rank the series, I would say the order would go 3 > 5 > 1 > 4 > 2. They're all great games, though, and the music is captivating.

text: What a fantastic, happy and playful game series. So glad I stumbled onto it in a gamestop a year ago. Definitely one of those "missed classics" games that would have defined my childhood and instead defined my early 20s

text:
It's strange how I got used to associating this song with April May. It's funny how this song was one reason why I decided to play the Phoenix Wright games for the first time. Currently on the second game :)

Also, I love the part starting from 0:16 :D

author: garfreeek

text: You should get to playing Dual Destinies at some point in the future, or at least listen to the soundtrack. It's an amazing jump in quality from the DS games to a newly made 3DS Phoenix Wright. The Objection theme gives me goosebumps.
author: TheTJWorks

text: I'm really excited for Professor Layton v Phoenix Wright that will be coming out at the end of the month.  I'm pretty sure that the music will be great too.
author: Eric C.

text: PLvsAA is an easy 9/10 for me. I am usually not a fan of series cross-overs as they bring fan service, but this one ? Oh man, I'm even guilty of thinking that a second one would be great. Also, the pursuit theme is by far my favorite above all those of the original series.
author: Nuclehon

text: @Darkpoulay Well that's good to know,  I haven't played a game from either series yet, but I think this may be my foray into both series.  Did you find the game to be difficult in any way?
author: Eric C.

text:
@Eric C. Not really. The puzzles of Professor Layton are super easy. Except for the DLC ones and a couple of them they were not really that hard.

The Phoenix Wright parts are really balanced, though.
author: Atay

text: @Dangan Fan Is it free DLC?  Thanks for the input.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. If I'm not mistaking, all the DLC is free but they will slowly be added.
author: Nuclehon

text:
@Eric C. Yeah, every friday (of at least in Spain) they add artwork or some especial episode with a puzzle (they are only 20 minutes short).

I have to say, they are super funny,they are breaking the 4th wall all the time xD.

There's literally a conversation like this:

Maya:This episode have been seen by at least, one million people!
Phoenix:Wait, was this game 3ven succesfull at all?
author: Atay

text: I finally bought Phoenix Wright 3, I'm looking forward to playing it as a lot of people think it's the best in the series. As a huge fan of the first two games, I'm excited. This theme brings back some really nice memories of me playing the first game during some cold winter days, in front of the warm fireplace.
author: SupraDarky

text:
Ace Attorney 3 > Ace Attorney 1 > Ace Attorney 2

That's how I would rank the trilogy, from best to worst... that doesn't mean AA2 is bad, it's just not as good as AA1 or AA3.

text:

a fan translation!
